instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message:
Hi, so I have bought medusa 3
I have mw own <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> i personally use, which doesnt have matching back case number, i get a bios from same model, read, and write it, i has clean me and fix checksum, but the year of the macbook didnt show up, what seems to be problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message: One thing to note is, the fan doesnt cycle 3 times after change serial number, instead 1 cycle and its turned on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message:
The 3 fan cycle is valid for 3437 board; 00165 must start directly.

Try to build another BIOS again, for the year issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message:
okay i would try, this macbook is also DEP locked from a unnamed university, can the dep locked be unlocked with svs clear like icloud lock ?
i got this board by buying dead board when I still couldnt microsolder repair a few years ago, im from third world country so our law regarding this is still weak, i wouldn;t get busted by fbi or something xD

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message:
Few BIOSes available on the forum, clean ME.
Try moddifying some of them with Medusa.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message: Sorry what do you mean by modifying? Is it changing the sn?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message:
Yes, change SSN and fix Fsys checksum.
You can try the files as you get them, just for testing and comparison purposes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message: any tutorial to change SN without medusa ? ( I havent buy the accesorry keyboard for medusa yet )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message:
or can you please make me two <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios with serial number :
C02LR2V56T5
C1MPP4KSG940
i will do the clean me and fix checksum with my medusa.., thankss

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting year /model after change sn
threads.message:
If you do it yourself will end learning, which should be in your advantage.
Make a backup of your boards first.
You can use any known good working BIOS file.
Open it in hex editor, modify serial number, upload to Medusa and do the rest on the MacBook board (with Medusa).
Try, try, try and come back if still need help...
